subject: Scooped
event: Well, the HOLLYWOOD REPORTER has spoiled part of my fun. How can I properly torment my readers if they're going to go around printing the news? http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/television/news/e3icaec2feffc977edcd7939413cf46b0d9 Yes, it's true. Jennifer Ehle has been cast as Catelyn Stark. Most of you will know her best from her portrayal of Elizabeth Bennet in the BBC's miniseries of PRIDE AND PREJUDICE in 1995, but she's got all sorts of other credits, she's won a BAFTA Award and two Tonys, and she will be a wonderful Catelyn. Fortunately, even HOLLYWOOD REPORTER doesn't know all the cool stuff I know, so I will still be able to smile engimatically and drop sly hints in Montreal. (I'll be good, I will, I will). I'm off tomorrow. See you there.

comments.article:
She will do well opposite Bean!
Excellent casting!
Excellent casting again! My daughter is named after Catelyn Stark (mostly because my husband wouldn't agree to Arya!), so I'm glad they picked a great actress for her :)
Haha, I named one of my cats Arya.  I wanted to name her brother Tyrion, but he's such an idiot that it would have been an insult to the real Tyrion.

comments.upictitle: ich hab euch etwas mitgebracht: Super
comments.article:
That is excellent news - I couldn't have picked a better Catelyn!

:D
Does a fangirl SQUEE!!!!
Jennifer Ehle is gorgeous!  It's good someone is printing it, because the male fans are getting rather antzy about wanting to know "where is the wimminz."
Oh this is just too exciting!  I love Jennifer Ehle and she'll be fantastic as Catelyn I know it!
And Cersei and Jaime are...? C'mon, you know that's who we're waiting for. :)

comments.upictitle: The Kwisatz Haderach, Give A Dog A Bone: pic#80183639
comments.article: I have it on good authority that Cersei and Jaime are being played by Teri Garr and Randy Quaid.
Every bit of news on this is making me more and more excited.
Oh I love her! She is SO perfect. I pictured her from the start. She is Awesome! 51% sweetie and 49%...well you get the picture. She will kick ass and kiss it better!

> 51% sweetie and 49%...

Yes, am thinking a blend of P&P and Camomile Lawn here...!

OH MY GOD YES. O/

Absolutely perfect! ♥
Oh fantastic news - love her.

comments.upictitle: Soufflé Girl Wannabe: John Help //Lady Rishikesh
comments.article: Oooh nice casting coup! She'll be fab and might even make me like Catelyn after all. Though she'll always be Cyn Powell (Lennon) in Backbeat first for me.

Darn that HOLLYWOOD REPORTER for spoiling the info! Darn them to...

???

waitaminit!

Huzzah! Thanks Hollywood Reporter :)
AWESOME!! Hehe those sneaks at the Hollywood Reporter ruined your fun! Who's going to pluck your magic twanger now!?!?

I LOVE Jennifer!
Great news!!!

She's lovely! And I'm sure she will make a great Catelyn. I was tempted to suggest Christopher Barry from "Lunatics: a Love Story" as a random red-headed Tully extra. But it's probably too late to put in suggestions. >-> Still, I'm excited about the casting so far!

I've gotten HBO for the past year just to be sure I didn't miss when it finally came together and got released! I'm SOOOOO looking forward to this series getting put onto television! I've been starving for good fantasy movies/shows for many, many years. Thanks so much for ALL of your effort!!

oh wow oh wow oh wow!

shes gorgeous and an amazing actress :) thats brilliant news!

I have not heard of her, but she definitely looks the part. And if she's won a BAFTA then, she's obviously talented. I love that it is being filmed in the UK with UK talent. It fits the tone of your novels better.

Now if we can just get Angelina Jolie to play Cersei. (I'll make an exception to the UK thing for her.)
Can't really picture Angelina Jolie as Cercei. Tricia Helfer on the other hand...

Yay, that's awesome news! I'm getting a crossover squee here. I loved her so much in P&P and Oscar Wilde.

Now go and cast Tricia Helfer as Cersei.

comments.upictitle: Not all those who wander are lost: poppies
comments.article: This actually excites me most of all of the news I've heard. I'm so glad Catelyn has been cast with an actress who can present her as the complex character she is!
I wish I could go to Montreal.
comments.subject: What cool stuff aren't you telling us?

comments.article: Up to now, I am truly amazed. The casting is GREAT, with Ned Stark being of course the best of all and Jon Snow a close second (unknown he may be, but Harington looks exactly the way I pictured Jon in my mind). Now I see that HBO have picked a very good Catelyn. My only doubts is about "your" Joffrey. I saw a pic in the internet, and Jack Gleeson seems too sweet and too young for the part. Oh well, maybe it's an old pic. In any case, congrats!!!
comments.subject: HBO Casting

comments.article: I think a sweet and young appearance is great, provided he's able to pull off the utter bastardry in his personality...
comments.subject: Re: HBO Casting

comments.article:
Wow, the cast-list is really racking up some pretty impressive names! If this keeps up, the result is going to be awesome.

... Not that it wasn't already, but still.
Oh. Oh, she'll be wonderful. Oh wow.
David Anders should be Jaime. He does evil prettiness so well.
